description: ir (first-person singular present voy, first-person singular preterite fui, past participle ido)
definitions: (reflexive) to go away, to leave. See irse.

(with preposition a followed by an infinitive), to be going to (near future)

Hoy vamos a ver una película.

Today we are going to see a movie.
etymology: The infinitive and forms beginning with i or y are from Latin īre, present active infinitive of eō (from Proto-Italic *eō, from Proto-Indo-European *h₁ey-); the forms beginning with v from corresponding forms of vādō; the forms beginning with f from corresponding forms of sum.
